jam.io.hdf
Class HDFile

java.lang.Object
  java.io.RandomAccessFile
      jam.io.hdf.HDFile
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.DataInput, java.io.DataOutput, HDFconstants
public final class HDFile
extends java.io.RandomAccessFile
implements HDFconstants

Class which represents the HDF file on disk.

Since:
JDK1.1
Version:
0.5 November 98
Author:
Dale Visser

Adds data element giving version of HDF libraries to use (4.1r2).

writeHeader

public void writeHeader()
                 throws HDFException
Writes the unique 4-byte pattern at the head of the file denoting that it is an HDF file.

Throws:
HDFException - error with writing hdf file

setOffsets

public void setOffsets()
Looks at the internal index of data elements and sets the offset fields of the DataObject's. To be run when all data elements have been defined.

writeDataObject

public void writeDataObject(DataObject data)
                     throws HDFException
Given a data object, writes out the appropriate bytes to the file on disk.

Parameters:
data - HDF data element
Throws:
HDFException - thrown if unrecoverable error occurs

addNumberTypes

public void addNumberTypes()
                    throws HDFException
Almost all of Jam's number storage needs are satisfied by the type hard-coded into the class NumberType. This method creates the NumberType object in the file that gets referred to repeatedly by the other data elements.

Throws:
HDFException - if the types cannot be created
See Also:
NumberType

addMachineType

public void addMachineType()
Add element which tells other hdf software the encoding used in Vdatas, etc.

See Also:
JavaMachineType

getDoubleType

public NumberType getDoubleType()
Returns:
the double number type.

getIntType

public NumberType getIntType()
Returns:
the int number type.

addDataObject

public void addDataObject(DataObject data,
                          boolean useFileDefault)

Adds the data object to the file. The reference number is implicitly assigned at this time as the index number in the internal Vector objectList. A typical call should look like:

hdf = new hdfFile(outfile, "rw");
hdf.addDataObject(new DataObject(this));

Each call causes setOffsets to be called.

Parameters:
data - data object
useFileDefault - if true, automatically assigns ref number, else lets object assign its own
See Also:
setOffsets()

                              throws HDFException
Throws:
HDFException - unrecoverable errror

addFileNote

public void addFileNote()
                 throws java.io.IOException
Add a text note to the file, which includes the state of JamProperties.

Throws:
java.io.IOException - if there's a problem writing to the file

JamProperties

checkMagicWord

public boolean checkMagicWord()
Checks whether this file contains the HDF magic word at the beginning.

Returns:
true if this file has a valid HDF magic word
